page.title: 02Study Area (Overview)
page.content: {LANDSCAPE { Study Area (Dyce) -- OVERVIEW The area of 12 Sq Kms with the co-ordinates 03840810 forming its S.W. corner, extends from the Tyrebagger Hill to Dyce Airport on the western fringe of the City of Aberdeen. Physically, this area forms part of an undulating and Easterly-sloping interfluve between the valleys of the Don and the Dee -- the twin rivers of Aberdeen. The height ranges from around 250 metres at the granite outcrop of the Tyrebagger and Elrick Hills to approximately 75 metres at Dyce Airport. This landscape has been extensively cloaked in a trail of glacial deposits -- still clearly evident in such locations as at the base of Elrick Hill and elsewhere, less obviously in the presence of large numbers of 'dry-stone' dykes.
